website_summaries.verdict: The Blade 15 Base Model trims a few frills from Razer's flagship Blade, but it keeps most of its best aspects. Just make sure you need the slim design; you're giving up some gaming grunt to gain it.
pros: Sleek design and quality build across the board
Superior display for a gaming laptop
Much better battery life than competitors
cons: No guarantee of 60fps gaming at maximum settings with this Max-Q graphics chip

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product! BUT PLEASE NOTE
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this short but please read if you are buying this. This laptop is absolutely amazing! Very sleek design and great performance overall. The only annoying thing was that the 1TB drive that came with it was 5400RPM. Not the worst thing in the world, but being a 5400 makes gaming a little sluggish. I ended up buying a 1tb SSD to replace it and it really brought the system to life. I really recommend this laptop if you are interested!

customer_reviews.title: 2 Months in

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming laptop razer blade 15 base model.
customer_reviews.text: This is my frst laptop, and I didn’t expected the performance coz it’s insane good.! There are other laptop which are hitting 100c at peak performance but this maintains at 70-80c which is useful and will help to improve the product life. Initially I thought of m15 Alienware due to heating issues I choose this product. Only issue is with the laptop flip there is a slight gap. customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Use Case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop for two primary purposes: graphic design and video editing. My previous laptop was not powerful enough to allow me to edit 4K footage, and really could only handle medium-sized Photoshop projects. The Razer Blade 15 has power to spare for these specific use cases. With the Nvidia graphics card, I am able to render out of Premiere Pro and After Effects minutes faster than my old laptop. I have also run up to 3 large Photoshop projects simultaneously without a stutter. I have done some mild gaming (Skyrim, Rocket League, Fortnite) and it performs extremely well with the games I own. I have certainly pushed it through its paces, though.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Margheim

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with this purchase. I do not play computer games but was looking for a powerful laptop for CPU heavy tasks. Been using macs for years and never really liked windows OS; but macs are ridiculously expensive now and windows just gives more bang for your buck. Overall, the laptop looks and feels expensive, but the track pad and ventilation system could be better. Upgraded the 256gb SDD for the 1tb samsung 960 pro for $300 and it is alot faster now. You’d be better off buying lower spec versions of razer laptops and upgrading yourself later on because its alot cheaper and samsung SSDs are the fastest.
